name: Gene Cooperman
content: Gene Cooperman's Home Page Gene Cooperman I do research in high performance computing and transparent checkpointing, including load balancing, support for newer architectures (e.g., GPUs), etc. First, some random pointers about me. I also do research in applying model checking for debugging parallel or concurrent software. RESEARCH REFEREED PUBLICATIONS (Note, also, the more than 150 refereed publications from the DMTCP site, most of which describe research of other teams in which they use our DMTCP project.) SOFTWARE MANA for MPI (Checkpointing MPI, using DMTCP platform) (with open-source software at GitHub: collaboration of NERSC, MemVerge and DMTCP team) So Why Can't I Checkpoint That? (video) (or alt): Historical perspective as a keynote talk at SuperCheck'21, Feb. 5, 2021, with slides from the keynote talk Video of talk (and slides) given at Microsoft Research Laboratory (Redmond) on Nov. 15, 2019 (see below for slides of earlier, more introductory material) DMTCP (Distributed Multithreaded Checkpointing) (led by a series of students) Extending DMTCP Checkpointing for a Hybrid Software World (or alt from MUG'17; a description of using DMTCP plugins to adapt to the external world) DMTCP: System-Level Checkpoint-Restart in User Space (a basic introduction to the internal architecture of DMTCP, from MUG'14) "McMini and DeepDebug: Efficient Deterministic Replay of Multithreaded Bugs" McMini (with docs/tutorial; for explicit-state model checking of multi-threaded programs; as simple as executing: mcmini ./a.out) OLDER SOFTWARE: Geant4MT (Geant4-MultiThreaded) (led by my former PhD student, Xin Dong; a multi-threaded parallelization of Geant4, the most detailed Monte Carlo simulation of particle-matter interaction: now appearing as part of Geant4 version 10.0 (see New Developments: "General"); also see our Euro-Par 2010 paper.) Roomy system for "Big Data" (led by my former PhD student, Dan Kunkle) TOP-C HOME PAGE (Task Oriented Parallel C/C++) ParGeant4 HOME PAGE ParGAP HOME PAGE ParGCL HOME PAGE Marshalgen TEACHING: In Spring, 2026, I will be teaching Accelerated/Advanced Computer Systems (CS 4973). TEACHING: In Fall, 2025, I will be teaching Computer Systems (CS 5600) (for M.S. students). TEACHING: In Spring, 2025, I taught Computer Systems (CS 3650). TEACHING: In Fall, 2024, I will be teaching Computer Systems Seminar (CS 7670). TEACHING: In Spring 2020, I taught a Ph.D.-level course, Special Topics in Systems (CS 7680). My office is in 336 WVH. My High Performance Computing Lab is in 370 WVH. The extension there used to be x7127. (phones being removed??) Next, some random pointers of interest to me.
